alert.note: Alert for Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 4:08PM EDT until April 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Florida... St Mary`s River At Macclenny affecting Nassau, Baker and Charlton Counties. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/forecasts.php?wfo=jax. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Mary`s River At Macclenny. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor flooding of low lying areas and timber lands including some properties along St. Mary`s River Bluff Road and the Cypress Landing Resort on the Georgia side. At 14.0 feet, Flooding of bottomlands along the river and some lower access roads including the lower half of St. Mary`s River Bluff Road which cuts off 15 to 20 homes on the Georgia side. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 12.3 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
